ch.aplu.tcpcom

Class TCPClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.tcpcom.TCPClient

  • public class TCPClient
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to create a TCP client socket handled by event callbacks.

      Same, but isVerbose = false
      TCPClient(java.lang.String host, int port, boolean isVerbose)
      Creates a TCP socket client prepared for a connection with a TCPServer at given address and port.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TCPClient

        public TCPClient(java.lang.String host,
         int port,
         boolean isVerbose)
        Creates a TCP socket client prepared for a connection with a TCPServer at given address and port. State changes invoke the callback onStateChanged().
        Parameters:
        host - the IP address of the host
        port - the IP port where to listen (0..65535)
        isVerbose - if true, debug messages are written to TCPLog

      • TCPClient

        public TCPClient(java.lang.String host,
         int port)
        Same, but isVerbose = false
        Parameters:
        host - the IP address of the host
        port - the IP port where to listen (0..65535)

    • Method Detail

      • addTCPClientListener

        public void addTCPClientListener(TCPClientListener listener)
        Registers a TCPClientTCPLogistener to get state change notifications.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to register

      • connect

        public boolean connect(int timeout)
        Creates a connection to the server (blocking until timeout).
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time (in s) for the connection trial (0: for default timeout)
        Returns:
        true, if the connection is established; false, if the server is not available or occupied

      • connect

        public boolean connect()
        Same as connect(int timeout) with system default timeout.
        Returns:
        true, if the connection is established; false, if the server is not available or occupied

      • isConnecting

        public boolean isConnecting()
        Returns true during a connection trial.
        Returns:
        true, while the client tries to connect

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns true if client is connected to a server.
        Returns:
        true, if the connection is established

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Closes the connection with the server.

      • sendMessage

        public java.lang.String sendMessage(java.lang.String msg,
                           int responseTime)
        Sends the information msg to the server (as String, the character \0 (ASCII 0) serves as end of string indicator, it is transparently added and removed). For responseTime > 0 the method blocks and waits for maximum responseTime seconds for a server reply.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to send
        responseTime - the maximum time to wait for a server reply (in s)
        Returns:
        the message or null, if a timeout occured

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        Same as sendMessage(String msg, int responseTime) with responseTime = 0.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to send

      • getVersion

        public static java.lang.String getVersion()
        Returns the library version.
        Returns:
        the current version of the library
